subject: Update interface_properties only when required
commit_message:
Update interface_properties only when required

Root cause of the issue is a race condition that takes place
when processing of two API requests intersects.

These requests are:
update node info from nailgun-agent and adding the same node
into an environment.

interface_properties.dpdk section is updated on both requests.
So, it was possible that request from nailgun-agent that comes
during the processing of adding node into environment overwrites
dpdk.available property with wrong value (value that was there
before adding the node into environment). It is because the changes
made during addition of node were not committed before start of
processing the update request from nailgun-agent.

Now, update request from nailgun-agent will not overwrite this value
in such situation because no DB update will be performed when
no changes are detected.

subject: Fix journal row locking
commit_message:
Fix journal row locking

Fixed the row locking for 2 issues:
1. The select for update and the row update to processing should be in
   one transaction, otherwise the select for update's lock will be
   released immediately since the session is running in auto-commit.
2. Handle Galera's deadlock exception which indicates that another

commit_message:
Integrate OSprofiler in Keystone

OSprofiler is an Oslo library dedicated to enable cross-service
OpenStack profiling. This makes possible to trace the OpenStack
request through all projects supporting the library, where the
profiling is enabled, and generate JSON and HTML human-readable
reports, describing what time was spent on which operation, e.g.
API or DB request.

This change inclues the following:

* Add settings for OSprofiler wsgi middleware
  This middleware is used for 2 things:
  1) It checks that person who want to trace is trusted and knows
     secret HMAC key (that is specified in paste.ini).
  2) It initalize profiler in case of proper trace headers
     and add first wsgi trace point, with info about HTTP request.
* Init profiler on start in both cases (httpd or eventlet)
* Adding new conf group for profiler (to enable/disable)
* By default osprofiler is disabled

TBD:
* Adding trace point for all DB (sql) calls. For proper format and
result oslo.db enginefacade module needs to be updated.

To test (old variant, will be changed with new commit to the
python-openstackclient):

$ . amdminrc # you should be admin user/tenant to fetch profiling data
$ keystone --profile SECRET_KEY user-list
$ osprofiler trace show --html --out result.html <TRACE_ID>

Old python-keystoneclient change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114856/

subject: Switch from optimal alignment to minimum
commit_message:
Switch from optimal alignment to minimum

fuel-agent always uses optimal alignment for partitions and
thoroughly relies on parted to perform that aligning. (-a optimal)

The issue is that under certain circumstances due to that alignment,
the end of particular partition could cross 1M boundary. And due to
actual partition' bounderies being rounded up, fuel-agent mistakenly
assumes that partition couldn't fit within provided boundaries and
raises errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError.

However, some h/w data storages are well known for reporting
relatively huge optimal IO sizes (16M or even bigger), so the 1M room
can't be enough. Thus, optimal aligning is not an option. Therefore,
parted has been switched to the minimum alignment.

The min value is the minimum aligment needed to align the partition
properly to physical blocks, which avoids performance degradation.

Change-Id: I83116ccc9236053a93664c1cf40a3ef0c1a189b7
Closes-Bug: #1543233
(cherry picked from commit 4c74eaa1875dd28d2e2c8256281d9088f83f25fb)

commit_message:
Fix: unable to delete instance when cinder is down

Ignore any cinder related exceptions that arise when you try to delete
an instance, so that the delete instance workflow isn't abruptly
interrupted (skipping necessary clean-up, etc).

In this case, we are intentionally catching all exceptions in addition
to a specific set of exceptions, so that the instance and related
resources aren't left in an unmanageable state when an unexpected
exception occurs. For example, currently you can't delete an instance
that's attached to a volume when cinder is down.

The existing error messages were also updated to include the block
device mapping volume id that triggered the exception.

keystone_authtoken section for a given service, keystonemiddleware will
create a secure temporary directory upon startup. For users not using
the 'pki' pr 'pkiz' token providers, this is unnecessary and causes
/tmp to fill up needlessly. This patch moves the directory
creation out of SigningDirectory.__init__ and into
SigningDirectory.calc_path, so that the first time calc_path is called,
the directory is created. If the user has provided the directory name,
we still log that and verify the directory at __init__. If the temp
directory must be created, we log and verify that only once at the time
of creation.

Closes-bug: #1533724
